intro: Ledebouria socialis, commonly known as the social bulbous plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Asparagaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale blue flowers during the summer months. Its bulbs are typically clustered and can be used for propagation. It is a low-maintenance plant that is well-suited for rock gardens and arid landscapes.
